intro: Cistanthe parryi, commonly known as Parry's cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are often pale pink or white, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Cistanthe parryi is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in full sun.
